intro: Rutidea smithii var. welwitschii, commonly known as the Welwitsch's Rutidea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, pink or red flowers. The plant typically grows in shrubland and rocky habitats, often in arid or semi-arid regions. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been introduced to other parts of the world for horticultural purposes. The species is also noted for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility in its native environment.
